hero.title: Deadlock Mod Manager
hero.description: Mods for Deadlock, minus the hassle. Find, install, and update mods in a couple of clicks. No folders, no guesswork.

oneClickInstall.title: One-click install
oneClickInstall.description: Grab a mod and we'll put it where Deadlock expects it. No manual steps, no guesswork.

manageWithConfidence.title: Manage with confidence
manageWithConfidence.description: See everything in My Mods. Toggle on/off, update, or remove whenever you like.

builtInBrowser.title: Built-in browser
builtInBrowser.description: Search and discover community mods without leaving the app. It's all in one place.

crossPlatform.title: Cross-platform
crossPlatform.description: Works on Windows, macOS, and Linux. Small download, quick start, low overhead.

openSource.title: Open source
openSource.description: Trust what you use. Read the code, file issues, or contribute features. Your call.

easyUpdates.title: Easy updates
easyUpdates.description: Out-of-date mods are clearly marked. Update them in one click.

stats.sectionDescription: A growing library of mods and an active community making Deadlock better every day.

showcase.sectionDescription: Discover popular mods, check them out, and install with a single click. No complicated setup required.

faq.sectionDescription: Have a different question and can't find the answer you're looking for? Check out our

whatIs.question: What is Deadlock Mod Manager?
whatIs.answer: A small desktop app that makes Deadlock modding simple. Browse, install, and manage mods without touching your game folders.

answer.step1: Download and open Deadlock Mod Manager.
answer.step2: We'll auto-detect Deadlock (or you can set the folder in Settings).
answer.step4: The app installs the mod in the right place. No manual steps.

isSafe.question: Is it safe to use mods?
isSafe.answer: Mods are third-party files. The app copies .vpk files to your game directory and doesn't patch your executable. Use good judgment and scan files if you're unsure.

howToUninstall.question: How do I uninstall mods?
howToUninstall.answer: Open My Mods and remove what you don't want, or use Clear All Mods in Settings.

platforms.question: Which platforms are supported?
platforms.answer: Windows, macOS, and Linux. Arch users can also install from the AUR.

reportBug.question: I found a bug, how do I report it?
reportBug.answer: You can report bugs by creating an issue on our
reportBug.answerSuffix: . Include steps to reproduce, what you expected, and what happened.

documentation.question: Where can I find more detailed documentation?
documentation.answerSuffix: for detailed guides, tutorials, and technical reference materials.

officialSkins.question: Will Deadlock have official skins?
officialSkins.answer: Deadlock is evolving. If official cosmetics arrive, this app will still be here for community-made options.

othersSeeSkins.question: Can other players see my installed skins?
othersSeeSkins.answer: No. These are client-side. Other players see default models and textures.

footer.description: A small, open-source app for installing and managing mods for the Valve game Deadlock.
footer.disclaimer: Not affiliated with Valve. "Deadlock" and related marks are trademarks of Valve Corporation.

downloads.pageDescription: Download the latest version for Windows, macOS, or Linux and start modding in minutes.
